document.title: Bilingual deaf children RU-Kentalis database
document.intro: Video recordings of 11 deaf children, for a longitudinal investigation of the bilingual language and communication development of young deaf children in Sign Language of the Netherlands (SLN) and Dutch (D). 5 boys and 6 girls 3 – 6 years old prelingual deafness (hearing loss of minimally 80dB Fletcher Index on the best ear) no mental restrictions Testscores for Nijmeegse Observatieschaal voor Kleuters (NOK) (SLN & D), Reynell Test voor Taalbegrip (SLN & D), Dutch version Assessing British Sign Language Development (SLN): data processed and coded in SPSS; Spider Story (SLN & D): data processed and coded in SPSS. Included in CSV f...
